text: Bill Cosby has performed in public for the first time since a sex abuse scandal embroiled him in 2015, telling stories and honouring old friends in his hometown on Monday as a retrial looms in his criminal sexual assault case. The 80 - year - old entertainer took the stage for about an hour at a Philadelphia jazz club for his first show since May 2015. He told stories, honoured old friends and finished by leading the band in a set, first using his mouth to scat in place of a missing horn section and then taking a turn at the drums. Cosby, handing the drumsticks off to the 11 - year - old son of the bass player, asked if the boy knew who he was and then told him. ` ` I used to be a comedian,'' Cosby deadpanned
